intro: Senecio cuspidatus, commonly known as the sharp-tip senecio, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and ragworts, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually linear and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are yellow and arranged in dense clusters. Senecio cuspidatus is often used in rock gardens due to its hardy nature and ornamental value.
